review: Bad game do not play. Go play TF2 instead.

Is overwatch "2" fun for new player? yes, I'm new and I had a BIT of fun in the game. (IF YOU'RE NOT PLAYING RANK, SO THAT MEANS I DON'T CONCERN IF I LOSE OR NOT IN A MATCH) 

Is the gameplay balanced? no, not in the slightest. the maps have a lot of chokehold which would probably be good for flanking right? Nope, Due to the balancing of the game, if your team have just 1 tank. the dps and support role will have to usually stick to the main tank. (it would be easier with an off tank, but even that will not be guaranteed if the enemy decided to drop cash to unlock the new heroes ASAP)

Speaking of new heroes, the new heroes introduced in OW2 is much better kitted than the OW1 returning heroes. But it is gatelocked about lvl 50 of the battlepass, unless you pay for it. (which I don't recommend, I'll explain later)

Now let's talk about the shop, it's a mess... you can smell the greed from a mile away. Skins cost a few $ to $20 for a premuim skin. (Some of which are not too different from the base skin, ie junker queen) Meanwhile from that same $20 you could buy 2-3 legendary skins on moba games that has unique visual mechanics and is animated differently. (Or better yet, an example similar to OW2. Paladins... the Maeve Raeve skin has a unique design and you have your own rave party on the battlefield)

Now let's talk about the battlepass, the battlepass of this game is probably the most slow battlepass system I had ever played. Usually these battlepasses on mobas and games take a new player from 0-4 levels in one match... and that took an average player like me with 3 hours. (it's pretty much telling you: "go to the shop... buy the battlepass premium to get what you want") and even with that, it's still slow... the rewards are now just pushed far earlier on but the xp needed is still the same huge amount. (while now it is better with daily and weekly challenges... it's still lacking if you compare it to mobas, shooters, and battleroyale battlepasses here that are basically giving out xp boosters or in-game currency boosters by logging in or extra minor events that give them when playing.)

The only good thing about this game is that it's much more server stable and less bugs compared to Paladins today. other than that Paladins is much more fun game. And not to mention Paladins has the skill system that OW2 scrapped.

Do I recommend the game? No, not if you want a long game that you could return to. (you can play OW2's basic heroes, and you pretty much already played what the game has to offer)

If you just want a quick game though and not care about competitive. Then the game can be fun. But honestly I would just recommend you to either play Paladins (not fully, but it's much more fun), TF2 (we just got a seal!), or Battleborne (lots of content as well)

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.
